Who am I?

Hi, my name is Redwan, and I'm an aspiring data scientist and machine learning practitioner.

As a trained life scientist, I strive to use data and technology to maximize the social impact of my work. Witnessing AI and data science improve our daily lives and transform businesses, I believe they're also poised to usher in the next industrial revolution and address the biggest challenges facing humanity—it was time to quit being a spectator. I've since then dedicated myself to pursuing a career in data science and eventually contributing to the evolution of machine intelligence.

This blog serves to chronicle my journey—sharing what I've learned, my experiences, and a few projects I'm working on.

What have I done?

I recently received a PhD in molecular physiology and biophysics from Baylor College of Medicine where I used carbon nanotechnology to develop a new treatment for autoimmune diseases. During grad school, I also founded and led a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that trains scientists and doctors to become management consultants. Previously, I worked in biomedical R&D and venture capital.

How to get in touch

Feel free to connect with me on LinkedIn or GitHub. If you'd like to be notified of new blog posts, you can subscribe to the feed or follow me on Twitter, which I use almost exclusively to talk about AI and data science. If you have any questions, tips or comments, don't hesitate to contact me directly. Thanks for visiting!
